DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Hemoglobin A2 Allele Type Result Percentage 0 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric laboratory percentage value measured, assigned or computed related to the hemoglobin A2 allele type.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Hemoglobin A2 Allele Type Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A tetrameric complex of 2 molecules of hemoglobin subunit alpha chains (encoded by either the HBA1 or HBA2 gene) and 2 molecules of hemoglobin subunit delta (encoded by the HBD gene)._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A tetrameric complex of 2 molecules of hemoglobin subunit alpha chains (encoded by either the HBA1 or HBA2 gene) and 2 molecules of hemoglobin subunit delta (encoded by the HBD gene).:Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A tetrameric complex of 2 molecules of hemoglobin subunit alpha (encoded by either the HBA1 or HBA2 gene) and 2 molecules of hemoglobin subunit delta (encoded by the HBD gene).

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Percentage Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Percentage Integer::0 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A number with no fractional part.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
